str2: And, even, also, namely.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To stand by, be urgent, befall one (as of evil), be at hand, impend. From epi and histemi; to stand upon, i.e. Be present.
And, even, also, namely.
Light, a source of light, radiance. From an obsolete phao; luminousness.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To shine, give light. A primary verb; to beam, i.e. Radiate brilliancy.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A prison cell. From oikeo; a tenement, i.e., a jail.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To smite, strike (as with a sword), smite to death, afflict. Probably prolongation from paio; to knock.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The side of the body. Of uncertain affinity; a rib, i.e. side.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.
Quickness, speed; hastily, immediately. From the same as tachus; a brief space, i.e. in haste.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A (light) chain, bond. Of uncertain derivation; a fetter or manacle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From ek and pipto; to drop away; specially, be driven out of one's course; figuratively, to lose, become inefficient.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A hand.
